_header: In Armorica that called is Brittany
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Franklin’s Tale of the Canterbury Tales — 896 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
Ther was a knyght that loued & did his peynein Armorike that
                    cleped is Bretaigne…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…now telleth me er that I ferther wendeI can no more my tale
                    is at an ende
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next folwyng bigynneth his tale (f. 249v); the
                    ffrankeleyne (RT); Here endith the ffrankeleyne his tale… (f.
                    262)

BodBar20.First Lines:
In armoryk þat callid is bretayneþer was a knyght
                    þat callid is bretayne…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…No telleþ me er þat I ferþer wendeI con no
                    more my tale is atte an end
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
ffrankeleyn (RT); here endith þe frankeleyns tale… (f.
                        161v)

Bod414.First Lines:
[T]her was a knyght that loued and did his peineIn Armorik that
                    clepid is Briteyne…
Bod414.Last Lines:
…Now tellith me ere that I further wendeI can no more my tale
                    is at an ende

Bod686.First Lines:
…And forto lede þe more in blisse hir lyvesOf his fre
                    wille he swore hir as a knyght…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…Now telleth me er þat ye ferther wendeI kan namore my
                    tale is at an ende
Bod686.Note:
V.709-28 (Prologue), 726-43 lost; 1013, 1455-6. 1493-8, omitted; 1286-9
                    inserted at foot.
Bod686.Attributed Title:
ffrankeleyn (RT); Here endeth the ffrankeleyns tale… (f.
                        148v)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
In Armorik þat called is BretaineThere was a knight þat
                    loued & did his paine…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…Now telleth me er ye ferther wendeI can no more my tale is at
                    an ende
BodHatDon1.Attributed Title:
Narrat (f. 99, margin); The ffrankelens tale (RT); Here endeth
                    þe ffrankeleyns tale of þe Rokkes of Bretaigne… (f.
                        109v)

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
THer was a knight þat loued and did his peyneIn armorik
                    þat clepud is bretayne…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…Now telleþ me er þat I ferþer wendeI can no
                    more my tale is at an ende

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[T]Here was a knyght þat louyd and dyd his peyneIn armorike
                    that clepyd is brytayn…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…Now tellez me er þat I ferther wendeI can
                    nomore my tale is at an ende

BodRawPoe223.First Lines:
In armorik that called was britayneTher was a kniȝt that loued
                    and did his payne…
BodRawPoe223.Last Lines:
…Now telleth me or that ye further wendeI can no more my tale
                    is at an ende
BodRawPoe223.Note:
Although referred to as the ‘Merchant’s Tale’ in the
                        incipit and explicit, the text is that of the
                        Franklin’s Tale. V.1455-6, 1493-8 omitted; 731-2, 893-4
                    reversed; 999-1000 follow 1006; 1541-4 follow 1550.
BodRawPoe223.Attributed Title:
…And here beginneth his tale folwing (f. 219); Arueragus Dorigen
                    Aurelius (RT); Here endeth the tale of the Marchaunt… (f. 232)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
In Armoryk that called is BretayneTher was a knyght þat loued
                    & dede his payne…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…Now telleth me er that ye ferther wendeI kan no more my tale
                    is at an ende
OxfChrCh152.Note:
V.1455-6, 1493-8 omitted; 1120 blank with caret versus in
                    margin.

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
Ther was a knight þat loued and did his peyneIn amoryke
                    þat cleped is Briteyne…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…Tuo ȝere or þre to respiten meþenne were I wel
                    for elles moste I selle…

“Digital
                    Facsimile of Corpus Christi, Oxford MS 198 of the Canterbury
            Tales”  .

ther was a knyght that louyd and did his peineIn Armorike that
                    callid is britaine…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:

CULDd424.First Lines:
…She seide sire sithe of ȝoure gentillesseȝe profre
                    me to haue so large a reyne…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…Now telleth me or that ȝe ferthere wendeI can namore my
                    tale is at an ende Amen

CULGg427.First Lines:
IN Armoryk that callyd is BritayneThere was a knyȝt that
                    louede & dede his payne…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…The valew of fyue hunderede pound I gesseAnd hym be sechith
                    of hise gentilesse…
CULGg427.Note:
V.1575-624 lost; 1132, 1455-6, 1473-4, 1493-8 omitted; spurious line
                    follows 1109.

CULIi326.First Lines:
In Amoryk that called is BretaynThere was a knyght that loued and

CULIi326.Attributed Title:
…And here begynneth his tale (f. 98v); ffrankleyn (RT);

CamFitzMc181.First Lines:
IN amoryk that kalled ys BretaynWhere was a knyght loued and dyd
                    his peyn…
CamFitzMc181.Last Lines:

CamTCC582.First Lines:
In armork that callid is BritaineThere was a kniȝt þat
                    loued and did his peine…
CamTCC582.Last Lines:
…Now tellith me or that ye forther wendeI can nomore my tale
                    is at an ende
CamTCC582.Attributed Title:
Hiere beginneth a tale of the ffrankeleyn (f. 108ra); Hiere is
                    finisshed the tale of the ffrankeleyn… (f. 113rb)

CamTCC595.First Lines:
IN Armoryke that called is BritaigneThere was a knyght that loued
                    & did his peyne…
CamTCC595.Last Lines:
…Nowe telleth me or ye ferther wendeI can no more my tale is
                    at an ende
CamTCC595.Note:
V.764, 772, 975, 1257-62, 1322, 1424, 1439-42, 1455-6, 1493-8 omitted;
                    818-19, 994-5 reversed; spurious line follows 976; 999-1000 follow 1006. A blank
                    space of approximately fifteen lines interevenes between the end of
                        Franklin’s Tale and the explicit, which occurs at the
                    foot of f. 201v.
CamTCC595.Attributed Title:
Here endeth the ffrankeleyns tale of the knyght / Averagus and dame
                    Dorygene his wyff / and the noble Philosophre of Orlyaunce… (f.
                        201v)

BLEge2863.First Lines:
…Who couthe telle but he hadde wedded beThe ioye the ese
                    & the prosperite…
BLEge2863.Last Lines:
…Now telleth me er þat I further wendeI can na more my
                    tale is at an ende
BLEge2863.Attributed Title:
The ffrankeleyn (RT); Here endith þe ffrankeleyns tale… (f.

BLEge2864.First Lines:
In Armoryk that called is brytayneTher was a knyht that loved and
                    did his payne…
BLEge2864.Last Lines:
…Nou telleth me er ye ferthere wendeI can no more my tale is
                    at an ende
BLEge2864.Attributed Title:

                    ffrankeleyn (RT); Explicit (f. 167)

BLHar1239.First Lines:
Lystenythe of a knygh of tyme ful oldeOff werrys he was wyse and
                    eke ful boldeA lady to his wyffe for love he chesseThat evere tyll hys
                    entent wolde hym plesseHe sayd in fayth for no erthly creatureWolde he
                    ne change wyle lyue may in dureAnd she to hym wysely gan swereþat
                    neuer shuld he deffaute in hyre…
BLHar1239.Last Lines:
…Now tel me or þat þe forth wendeI can no more my
                    tale is at an ende
BLHar1239.Note:
V.870-80, 939-50, 1123-241, 1453-562 lost; 882-4, 951-5 partially lost
                    (tear);709-88, 1284, 1296, 1405 omitted; six spurious lines precede 789 (the
                    first line of text). On 106v is a colophon: ‘Vestre
                        magnifice & generosissime dominacionis humilimus seruiens / & ser
                        Orate heremita de Grenewych mundo quasi totaliter / segregatus ac mentibus
                        suorum fortune amicorum & hominum per / oblitus’.

BLHar1758.First Lines:
THere was a knyght that loueyd and did his payneIn armorike that
                    clepid is Britayne…
BLHar1758.Last Lines:
…Now tellith me er that I ferthir wendeI can no more my tale
                    is at an ende
BLHar1758.Note:
V.1147-8, 1423-4, 1433-4, 1436, 1455-6, 1493-8, 1529 omitted; 729-30,
                    917-18, 987-8, 1147-8, 1265-6, 1345-6, 1353-4 reversed; spurious line follows
                    1530. Large blank space between the explicit for the Franklin’s
                        Tale and the incipit for the Second Nun’s
                    Prologue.
BLHar1758.Attributed Title: The ffrankeleyn (RT); Here endith the ffrenkeleyns tale (f. 137)

BLHar7333.First Lines:
IN Amoryk þat callid is britayneþer was a knyȝt and
                    loved and ded his peyn…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…Now tellithe me er ye furþer wendeI can no more my tale
                    is at an ende
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
And here begynnithe þe ffranklens tale (f. 82vb); Here
                    Endithe the ffrankleyn his tale… (f. 86va)

BLHar7334.First Lines:
…lasse þan a þousand pound he wolde noght haueNe
                    gladly for þat somme he wolde not goon…
BLHar7334.Last Lines:
…Now telleþ me or þat I ferþer wendeI can no
                    more my tale is at an ende
BLHar7334.Attributed Title:
ffrankeleynes Tale (RT); Here endeth þe ffrankeleynes tale… (f.
                    162)

BLHar7335.First Lines:
[I]N Armoryk that called was BreteigneTher was a knyght that louede
                    and dede his peyne…
BLHar7335.Last Lines:
…Now tellith me or that ye ferthere wendeI can no more my tale
                    is at an endeYee late that passe quod oure host as nowSire doctour of
                    phisik y pray youTelle vs a tale at my prayereHit shal be doon if that
                    ye wil hit hereSaid this doctour and his tale bygan anoonNow good men
                    quod he herkenyth euerichon
BLHar7335.Note:
V.1455-6, 1493-8, 1593-4 omitted; 999-1000 follow 1006; six spurious
                    lines follow 1624 (functioning as a ‘Franklin-Physician
                    Link’).

Plimpton253.First Lines:
Ther was a knyȝt that loued and dede his peyneIn armorike that
                    called was brytaynne …[f. 1v, 730-29]
…Than sawe he knyȝtes Iosten in aplaynAnd after this he
                    dede hym suche plesaunce…[f. 2, 1198-9]
Plimpton253.Last Lines:
…Saue that the name of souereygnteThat wolde he haue for shame
                    of his degre…[f. 1v, 751-2]
…To make his iapes and his wrechednesOf whiche a sibstocems
                    cursidnes…[f. 2v, 1271-2]
Plimpton253.Note: Fragments on two leaves. V.729-30 reversed; 753-1197 lost.
Plimpton253.Facsimiles:
Digital Scriptorium: Facsimile of Plimpton MS 253.
         Columbia University, 1996-.

…Now telleth me or that ye forther wendeI can nomore my tale
                    is at an ende
